dbdiffchecker

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbdiffchecker.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Database models a MYSQL database schema.
    Since:
    9-18-17
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database()
      This is the default constructor for this class which is needed for Serialization.
      Database(dbdiffchecker.DbConn db)
      Initializes a Database object by using a database connection.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Determines which table(s) is/are to be created or dropped.

      Returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTables()
      Returns a HashMap of tables that are in the database provided.
      java.util.ArrayList<View> getViews()
      Returns all of the views in the database.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tablesDiffs(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
      Compares the two HashMaps which represent the tables in the live and dev databases, and returns a HashMap of table names whose structure did not match between the dev and live databases.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> live, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> updateTables)
      Takes in two table lists which are HashMaps, and returns the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same table definitions as the dev one.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateViews(java.util.ArrayList<View> liveViews)
      Takes in a list of views and returns the SQL statements needed to make the two databases have the exact same views.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database(dbdiffchecker.DbConn db)
         throws DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException
        Initializes a Database object by using a database connection. The database provided connection is used to initialize a HashMap of tables and views that exist in the database provided and get SQL statements to drop all Primary Keys and remove all auot_increments in the database provided which will only be used on the live database.
        Parameters:
        db - The database connection used to get the database information
        Throws:
        DatabaseDiffernceCheckerException - Error connecting or closing the database connection.

      • Database

        public Database()
        This is the default constructor for this class which is needed for Serialization.

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstSteps

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFirstSteps()
        Returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements. These SQL statements are used to drop Primary Keys and remove auto_increments on the database provided. Note: this function will return an empty ArrayList if the function is called on the dev database.
        Returns:
        The first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements

      • getTables

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> getTables()
        Returns a HashMap of tables that are in the database provided. The key is the name of the table and the value is a Table object.
        Returns:
        All of the tables in the provided database.

      • getViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<View> getViews()
        Returns all of the views in the database.
        Returns:
        All of the views in the database..

      • updateViews

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateViews(java.util.ArrayList<View> liveViews)
        Takes in a list of views and returns the SQL statements needed to make the two databases have the exact same views. Note: all views in the live database will be dropped and all from the dev database will be created.
        Parameters:
        liveViews - all of the View in the live database.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Strings which is the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same views as the dev one.

      • compareTables

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> compareTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
        Determines which table(s) is/are to be created or dropped.
        Parameters:
        liveTables - is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which represent all tables in the live database.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Strings which is the SQL statements to run in order to remove and/or create tables in the live database.

      • updateTables

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> updateTables(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> live,
                                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> updateTables)
        Takes in two table lists which are HashMaps, and returns the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same table definitions as the dev one.
        Parameters:
        live - is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which are the names of the tables and table data for each table in the live database.
        updateTables - is a HashMap of String and String pairs where the key and the value are the same, which is all the tables which are not the same in the live and dev databases.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Strings which is the SQL statements to run in order to make the live database have the same table definitions as the dev one.

      • tablesDiffs

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tablesDiffs(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Table> liveTables)
        Compares the two HashMaps which represent the tables in the live and dev databases, and returns a HashMap of table names whose structure did not match between the dev and live databases.
        Parameters:
        liveTables - is a HashMap of String and Table object pairs which are the table names and table data for all tables in the live database.
        Returns:
        An HashMap which is the tables that are to be updated because their structures did not match between the dev and live databases.
